intro: Afrolimon longifolium, commonly known as the African limon, is a flowering plant native to the savannas of sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Afrolimon longifolium is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its fragrant foliage and delicate blossoms.
